member.name: DirectX.D3D10CompileEffectFromMemory

summary.div: Note Use D3DX10CompileFromMemory instead of this function.

member.param: A pointer to effect data; either ASCII HLSL code or a compiled effect.
Length of pData.
The name of the effect file.
Optional. An array of NULL-terminated macro definitions (see ).
Optional. A pointer to an ID3D10Include Interface for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.
Shader compile options.
Effect compile options.
The address of a that contains the compiled effect.
Optional. A pointer to an that contains compiler error messages, or NULL if there were no errors.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10CreateEffectFromMemory
member.summary: Creates an ID3D10Effect from a buffer containing a compiled effect.
member.param: A pointer to a compiled effect.
Length of pData.
Effect compile options.
A pointer to the device (see ).
Optional. A pointer to a memory space for effect variables that are shared across effects (see ).
A pointer to an which contains the created effect.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10CreateEffectPoolFromMemory
member.summary: Create an effect pool (or shared memory location), to enable sharing variables between effects.
member.param: A pointer to a compiled effect.
Length of pData.
Effect compile options.
A pointer to the device (see ).
A pointer to the that contains the effect pool.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10CreateStateBlock
member.param: The device for which the state block will be created.
Indicates which parts of the device state will be captured when calling and reapplied when calling . See remarks.
Address of a pointer to the buffer created (see ).
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10DisassembleEffect
member.summary: This function -- which disassembles a compiled effect into a text string that contains assembly instructions and register assignments -- has been deprecated. Instead, use D3DDisassemble10Effect.
member.param: A pointer to an , which contains the compiled effect.
Include HTML tags in the output to color code the result.
A pointer to an which contains the disassembled shader.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskDifference
member.summary: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise XOR.
member.param: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise XOR operation. See .
State block mask on the right side of the bitwise XOR operation.
The result of the bitwise XOR operation.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskDisableAll
member.summary: Disable all state capturing with a state-block mask.
member.param: A mask filled with all zeroes (see ).
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskDisableCapture
member.summary: Disable state capturing with a state-block mask.
member.param: A state block mask (see ).
The type of device state to disable (see ).
The lower end of the range of values to set to false.
The upper end of the range of values to set to false.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskEnableAll
member.summary: Enable a state-block mask to capture and apply all state variables.
member.param: A mask with everything turned on.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskEnableCapture
member.summary: Enable a range of state values in a state block mask.
member.param: A state block mask (see ).
The type of device state to enable (see .
The lower end of the range of values to set to true.
The upper end of the range of values to set to true.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskGetSetting
member.summary: Get an element in a state-block mask; determine if an element is allowed by the mask for capturing and applying.
member.param: State block mask. See .
The type of device state. See .
The entry within the device state. This is only relevant for state types that have more than one entry, such as D3D10_DST_GS_SAMPLERS.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified feature is allowed by the mask for capturing and applying, and false otherwise.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskIntersect
member.summary: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise AND.
member.param: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise AND operation. See .
State block mask on the right side of the bitwise AND operation.
The result of the bitwise AND operation.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10StateBlockMaskUnion
member.summary: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise OR.
member.param: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise OR operation. See .
State block mask on the right side of the bitwise OR operation.
The result of the bitwise OR operation.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.
